name: api_transport-pager-tree_get_collection
description: Retrieves the collection of TransportPagerTree resources.

properties[].description: Allows you to reduce the response to contain only the properties you need. If your desired property is nested, you can address it using nested arrays. Example: properties[]={propertyName}&properties[]={anotherPropertyName}&properties[{nestedPropertyParent}][]={nestedProperty}

$block: The TransportPagerTree resource is a collection of transports that carry dispatched alerts to the external Pager Tree service.

$ul: **createdAt**: When the resource instance was created. This date-time is in the UTC timezone.
**dataSegmentCode**: User-provided string on which to segment and filter data. Max 50 characters.
**id**: The unique identifier of the resource instance.
**pagerTreeAccessToken**: The access token for the Pager Tree service. Stored in encrypted format.
**pagerTreeAccountUserId**: The account user ID for the Pager Tree service. (Must supply either team ID, router ID or account user ID.)
**pagerTreeRouterId**: The router ID for the Pager Tree service. (Must supply either team ID, router ID or account user ID.)
**pagerTreeTeamId**: The team ID for the Pager Tree service. (Must supply either team ID, router ID or account user ID.)
**pagerTreeUrgency**: The urgency for the Pager Tree service.
**partition**: The partition that contains this resource instance. The resource cannot be moved to another partition.
**resourceOwner**: The name of the person who owns this resource.
